DYAD: EQUATORIAL GUINEA-GABON
RIVALRY: RIV1048
DISPUTE(S): MID1340 

PS: 19681012-19720822 0.5 19720823-20161114 .25 20161115-20209999 0.5

PS-UPDATE2020: Relationship shifts to negative peace with the signing of the Gabon-Guinea Agreement, ending the border dispute (https://www.unmultimedia.org/s/photo/detail/704/0704192.html; https://africatimes.com/2016/11/17/gabon-equatorial-guinea-agree-to-end-territorial-dispute-over-islands/) o	Both states agree to submit their border dispute to the ICJ for arbitration to decide the common maritime and territorial boundaries and sovereignty over Mbani√©, Cocotiers and Conga islands (http://country.eiu.com/article.aspx?articleid=304867614&Country=Equatorial%20Guinea&topic=Politic_8


PSNOTES: Two states go to ICJ, which ends the dispute presumably, but this is not till late 2016

thompson rivalry cm411481 ,19720000 ,ongoing 

Equatorial Guinea became independent on October 12, 1968.

PS-LAST-CHANGED: 20220615
PS-LAST-CHECKED: 20220615

Territorial-Maritime-Boundary Issues Variables

MID1340

TERRMID: MID1340 3 -- not territory
TERRMID-CER: MID1340 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID1340 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID1340 1 -- certain
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID1340 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID1340 1 -- certain
MARITMID-NOTES: MID1340 from Gibler 2018, Equatorial Guinea and Gabon had a maritime and islands dispute (the maritime boundary was connected to the disputed islands). Coded maritime MID because this MID is connected to a disputed maritime border. See ISLMID-NOTES. 

ISLMID: MID1340 1 -- islands MID
ISLMID-CER: MID1340 1 -- certain
ISLMID-NOTES: MID1340 from Gibler 2018, Equatorial Guinea and Gabon had conflicting claims over uninhabited islands in Corisco Bay. In 1972, Gabon established outposts on the islands and Equatorial Guinea appealed to the UNSC for assistance in the dispute. Coded islands MID because this was connected to disputed islands. 

CIVWARMID: MID1340 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID1340 1 -- certain
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID1340 3 -- not civil war link
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID1340 1 -- certain
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID1340 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID1340 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID1340 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID1340 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

RIVNOTES: 

NARRATIVE-CM:
Equatorial Guinea and Gabon disputed their maritime border in the Bay of Corisco beginning on August 23, 1972, when Gabon extended its territorial waters to 100 nautical miles. Equatorial Guinean troops clashed with Gabonese troops near the islands from August 23 to September 7, 1972. President Bongo of Gabon referred the matter to the *United Nations* (UN) Secretary-General Kurt Waldheim on September 8, 1972. Equatorial Guinea appealed for an immediate meeting of the UN Security Council on September 12, 1972. President Mobutu of Congo-Kinshasa and President Ngouabi of Congo-Brazzaville mediated negotiations between the countries from September 16 to November 13, 1972. President Francisco Macias Nguema of Equatorial Guinea and President Bongo of Gabon signed an agreement on November 13, 1972, which provided for the "neutralization" of the disputed region in the Bay of Corisco. The *Organization of African Unity* (OAU) established a border demarcation commission chaired by President Ngouabi of Congo-Brazzaville. Equatorial Guinea and Gabon signed an accord in 1974.

SOURCES-CM: 
*Africa Contemporary Record *(ACR), 1972-1973; *Africa Research Bulletin* (ARB), September 1-30, 1972, October 1-31, 1972, November 1-30, 1972; Butterworth, 1976, 463-464; *Keesing*, November 18-25, 1972.

NARRATIVE-CR:

SOURCES-CR:

MARITIME-MIDS: MID1340

MARITIME-LAST-CHECKED: 20141229 

MARITIME-DISPUTE: MID1340
 DYAD: EQUATORIAL GUINEA GABON 411481
 DATES: 19720601 19720918
 HOSTILITYA: 4 FATALITYA: 0
 HOSTILITYB: 3 FATALITYB: 0

Discussion:
Equatorial Guinea and Gabon disputed their maritime border in the Bay of Corisco beginning on August 23, 1972, when Gabon extended its territorial waters to 100 nautical miles. Equatorial Guinean troops clashed with Gabonese troops near the islands from August 23 to September 7, 1972. President Bongo of Gabon referred the matter to the *United Nations* (UN) Secretary-General Kurt Waldheim on September 8, 1972. Equatorial Guinea appealed for an immediate meeting of the UN Security Council on September 12, 1972. President Mobutu of Congo-Kinshasa and President Ngouabi of Congo-Brazzaville mediated negotiations between the countries from September 16 to November 13, 1972. President Francisco Macias Nguema of Equatorial Guinea and President Bongo of Gabon signed an agreement on November 13, 1972, which provided for the "neutralization" of the disputed region in the Bay of Corisco. The *Organization of African Unity* (OAU) established a border demarcation commission chaired by President Ngouabi of Congo-Brazzaville. Equatorial Guinea and Gabon signed an accord in 1974.

SOURCES: Gibler, D.M. 2018. Militarized Interstate Dispute Narratives, 1816-2010. Langham, MD: Rowman and Littlefield.
